section.title: Function | Insert f'(x)
section.para: The dialog shown below is used to insert the first derivative of the selected function. If the function is a standard function, the first derivative is the slope of the function, and it is defined as the function differentiated with respect to x: f'(x) = df(x)/dx

You can select interval, line style, width in pixels and color of the functions derivative. The derivative is inserted as a function and can be edited as such. The derivative will not change if you edit the original function.
